title: Do Motorists Now Face $999 Fines and 3-Year Suspensions for Using Cellphones While Driving?
subtitle: A number of recent laws have focused on preventing distracted driving, but the penalties vary from location to location.
author: Dan Evon
vclaim: Motorists will be fined $999 and have their licenses suspended for three years if they are caught using, or even holding, cellphones while driving.
